fields.description:
As the stage deleted files from the UI doesn't work, I did it via the command line. Once you come back to the UI and click View -> Refresh, the UI hangs with CPU at 100% on that core. I've tried uninstalling and reinstall, but it hangs again on start. SourceTree is now unusable.

The log has the line.
ERROR [2016-02-17 16:29:30,230] [1] [SourceTree.Bookmarks.BookmarkManager] [RegisterBookmarkEventHandlers] - RegisterAsRepositoryUpdatedEventHandler called with null repo
fields.summary: Hangs when command line Stage Deleted file then go back to UI

fields.description: Please see the attachment. It happened after upgrading to 1.8.0.36401.
fields.summary: Commit from SourceTree doesn't show my name in Stash

fields.description:
Given SourceTree is open and the current tab is for repository A
When I call sourcetree -f <path to repository B>
Then the SourceTree icon flashes in the task bar but repository B is not opened

Prior to 1.8.1 repository B would open in SourceTree.
fields.summary: sourcetree -f does not open path when sourcetree is running

fields.description:
Diff fails to show new line added at end of file.

Repro:
* Create a new file with a single line of text (+newline at EOF)
* Commit said file
* Add a second line (+newline at EOF)
* Commit file again
* View diff (in SrcTreeWin) for most recent commit. Note that the added line isn't shown
* Sigh deeply
* Uninstall SourceTree 1.8.1
* Reinstall 1.7
* Get on with life
fields.summary: Diff viewer doesn't show line added at end of file

fields.description:
Before - 003
After - 002
fields.summary: Cannot correctly display UTF-8 character anymore

fields.description:
If a file is in the "Unstaged files" section with a minus sign next to it and you tick it to stage it, SourceTree raises the error below:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false rm -q -f -- FileLogHelper.cs
fatal: pathspec 'FileLogHelper.cs' did not match any files

Completed with errors, see above.
fields.summary: Failure on Stage file to Delete

After update sourcetree

there's some miscellaneous things for me to complain but I'll try to accustom myself.
but this one make me crazy. so please fix this.
or is there any way of staging some selected files on log & history views with one action except clicking check box one by one with waiting list fully updated?

fields.description:
Everytime i do the following steps SourceTree crashes

1) Resolve the conflict by launching external tool. In my case  i am using perforce merge
2) Make changes, click save and close  the diff file.
3) SourceTree crashes.

The same happens when i use KDiff3 as my external diff/merge tool


System.NullReferenceException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf.dll
Additional information: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.

I tried downgrading to lower versions (1.6 and 1.7)  and now it crashes on launch.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes consistently on Windows 10
In last version(1.8.1.0) I don't see my name when I commit code because theme so light.

fields.description:
Attempting to stage files that have been deleted (i.e. check in the deletion) results in sourcetree errors. command line git is properly tracking, seems to be UI related. 

Manually adding them through git command line works just fine.
fields.summary: Sourcetree will not stage deletion of files

fields.description:
donloaded latest update, worked for a few hours, then crashed trying to add deleted files to commit, now it crashes as soon as I open it, got this exception from VS debug. trying removing and reinstalling.

System.ArgumentException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.ArgumentException' occurred in PresentationFramework.dll
Additional information: The number of elements in this collection must be less than or equal to '65535'.
fields.summary: Crashes on startup
Crashed while trying to merge with hg

fields.description:
Just upgraded to 1.8.1.0 (according to the about box) and I've found the Diff view has regressed in usability, as the buttons for Staging and Discarding hunks are frequently off scrolled off screen. Pretty sure they were always on screen in the previous versions.

See attached image for an example of what I'm seeing.

I feel like the buttons to Stage and Discard hunks should always be visible, regardless of the whether the diff area has a horizontal scroll bar or not.
fields.summary: The Stage and Discard hunk buttons are not always visible

fields.description:
I was really sceptical that the problem is in my machine. I tested the command I saw in the window 
sh.exe C:\Users\MyUserName\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d

in git bash and the problem was with the backslashes. I changed them to forward slashes 
sh.exe C:/Users/MyUserName/AppData/Local/Atlassian/SourceTree/gitflow_local/gitflow/git-flow init -d
and it worked fine.

I also tested initializing the gitflow with gitkraken and it worked like charm. So the problem happened after I updated to latest version my Sourcetree.

I updated my system Git to latest as well and tested sourcetree again, without success.
fields.summary: Latest Sourcetree cannot initialize gitflow on Windows

fields.description:
Hey there,

I installed the latest version and this required me to log in to my atlassian account in the Sourcetree program and allowed you to edit some settings but I never was able to edit them and got jumped into the program and the pop up disappeared.

I tried to locate the place for editing or logging out and in again but this is not present.
fields.summary: Can't logout or edit account info in Sourcetree
Crash when trying to push to remote repository

fields.description:
After updating today to SourceTree 1.8.1, I'm no longer able to multi-select lines in the diff viewer.

*STR:*
1. Make several changes to a file in a Git repo that's added to SourceTree
2. In the unstaged files section, click on the modified file, to update the diff panel to the right
3. In the diff panel to the right, click one changed line, then hold down shift whilst you click another changed line (ie: to select multiple lines)
4. Press discard lines to discard those parts of the changes

*Expected:*
At step 3, selecting multiple lines works, like it used to prior to 1.8.1. (Discarding or staging only part of a hunk is something I do a lot - often changes are too close together to be able to use the "{discard,stage} hunk" buttons).

*Actual:*
At step 3, clicking the second line (when shift is held down) causes the first line to become unselected, as though shift wasn't being held down at all. As a result, only one line (the second line clicked) remains selected, and not the range of lines between the two.
fields.summary: No longer able to select multiple lines in diff viewer using shift-click

fields.description:
In the "File Status" view, when the view is set to "Pending files, sorted by checked / unchecked", the diff viewer will only show the staged files or it will only show unstaged files. 
If it is currently showing staged files and I click on any unstaged file, it will not show the unstaged file. If it is currently showing unstaged files and I click on any staged file, it will not show the staged file.
fields.summary: Staged and unstaged files are not shown in diff viewer

fields.description: Installed update, Failed when executed.
fields.summary: Launching application fails

fields.description:
The Authenticate window repeatedly pops up asking for login information.
I have deleted the offending entry in SourceTree->Options->Authentication and it has been remade by askpass.exe. I have done the process with restarts of SourceTree at every step.

Askpass pops up every ~10 seconds

I had to manually kill askpass after closing SourceTree as Askpass still kept popping up long after SourceTree was closed.
fields.summary: Authenticate (AskPass.exe) repeatedly asks for information

Regardless of which component has focus, if you press Enter, SourceTree 1.8.1.0 wants to commit.  If you type a word into the file filter box, it does not filter as you type, so it would seem like pressing enter when the cursor is in the box, would apply the filter.
Instead, it tries to commit.

fields.description:
I have updated my version of Source Tree to: 1.8.1, and now when I try to open, push, or pull the application throw me an exception with ssh-agent.

+*I cannot connect with my GIT server.*+

Technical specifications:
1. Windows 8.1 u1 (x64).
2. Git version 1.9.5
3. Security Key: SSH
fields.summary: SSH-Agent Failed with code -1

fields.description:
Whenever I push changes in SourceTree, the interior view is automagically changing from "Log/History" to "File Status"

REPRO:

1. In SourceTree, click on "Log/History" for the current branch
2. Click on "Push", ensure the current branch is checked in the dialog, and then click "OK"
3. The "Pushing" dialog displays, showing full output.
4. After clicking the "Close" button, note that the underlying view is automagically reset to "File Status".

Expected

My interior view should NOT change after pushing. When the dialog closes, I should still be viewing "Log / History".

EDIT

This issue also happens when "Pulling" changes and when switching branches. Presumably, it also happens after a commit. So, basically any iteractions with the graph are causing SourceTree to redraw itself, using "File Status" as the default view.

This is actually a VERY ANNOYING BUG because after each major operation in SourceTree, I need to reset my view.
fields.summary: After "Pushing" changes, view automatically changes from "Log/History" to "File Status"

fields.description:
Interface will force a transition of tabs from Log/History to File Status, even when there aren't changes to the Working Copy. I see that the intended behavior is to change to File Status when there are changes, but that's still bad design. Under no circumstances should it force a view change. 

 !image-2016-02-16-16-24-03-947.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Interface forces switching to File Status randomly (and not randomly)

fields.description:
After updating to the latest release today (v1.8.1.0). SourceTree will crash after closing "Beyond Compare" external merge tool. It crashes only when returning after the conflicting file has been saved. The external merge tool is being launched using the right click context menu option > Resolve Conflicts > Launch External Merge Tool.

{noformat}
System.NullReferenceException was unhandled
Message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.NullReferenceException' occurred in SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf.dll
Additional information: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
{noformat}

The crashed thread was named "Worker Thread" if thats any help. But without debug symbols I wont be able to give you a full stack trace. I notice a "<filename>.orig" file being created after I return from the external tool. This is not created by "Beyond Compare". So this also might be related to the issue. It would seem to crash after ST has created this file.

This bug of course makes fixing merge conflicts a nightmare. If a fix for this is not forthcoming I think I might have to revert to a previous version of SourceTree, somehow? Advice is appreciated.

I've attached screenshots of all the relevant screens.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after closing external merge tool.

fields.description:
!image-2016-02-16-16-11-26-593.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2016-02-16-16-12-09-131.png|thumbnail! 

Very serious issue. Have attempted reinstall and reboot. Issue persists. I can't stage file deletions, so I can't proceed with this commit. Gonna need to resort to the git shell until this is resolved for file deletions.
fields.summary: File deletions cannot be staged

fields.description:
STEPS:
# change several files
# verify "Unstaged files" lists those files
# click on the checkbox for one file to move it to "Staged files"
# verify "Staged files" contains just one file
# click on that Staged file
# observe that the diff preview pane does NOT show the diff for the Staged file. It shows the diff for the selected Unstaged file
# right-click on that Staged file and select External Diff
# observe that the diff is NOT for the file you right-clicked on. It shows the diff for the selected Unstage file

EXPECTED:
When you select the Staged file, you can see it's diff

NOTES:
# this worked in the previous version
# This isn't specific to just having one Staged file.  the app is either in a state where "Staged Files" diff doesn't work, or "Unstaged Files" diff doesn't work.  
## if you move a file Unstaged -> Staged, then diffing Unstaged is broken
## if you move a file Staged -> Unstaged, then diffing Staged is broken

I suspect the entire ContextMenu is broken as well.  E.g. in the first case, right click on an unstaged file and select "External Diff" and you will incorrectly get the diff on the "Staged file" that is selected.

SEVERITY
SourceTree 1.8.1 is pretty unusable for me, given that I spend 95% of my time in the Working Copy view.
fields.summary: Working Copy view file context broken unless you only have Staged files, or only have Unstaged files

Fatal Error
Unreadable Text on Commit Screen

fields.description:
After I finished upgrading SourceTree to 1.8.1.0, it crashed and instructed me to upload this log file so here it is.

I didn't do anything, this happened as soon as I finished the wizard that runs at the beginning.  I had logged into my Atlassian account (with Google) and then logged into a BitBucket account.  After logging into the BitBucket account, the continue button was grayed out so I clicked "Skip Setup"
fields.summary: Upgrade to SourceTree 1.8.1 crashed upon opening.

fields.description:
This is a new issue that just cropped up after the big UI change that I installed today (2/16/16). 

When on the File Status tab with unstaged changes you have to scroll sideways to get to the stage/discard hunk/lines buttons. After looking at it for a bit it seems like those buttons now always align with the rightmost edge of the widest "code window". In previous versions those buttons always aligned with the right edge of the whole window so that they were always visible to the user and able to be clicked. The new location is messy looking and pretty obnoxious to have to scroll sideways when looking through multiple diffs and staging them.
fields.summary: Stage/Discard buttons in unstaged changes diff view are misplaced

fields.description: When hovering over the commit button, the background color brightens to the point that the white text is barely legible.
fields.summary: Font color on commit button

fields.description: Trying to clone project from "Hosted repositories" windows (repo on github with ssh remote)
fields.summary: Error after/during project clone

fields.description:
Clicking the checkbox next to Unstaged files, which used to select all files, has no effect. Only the checkbox at the very top of the interface and the ones next to individual files work.

Also, I think the Staged files / Unstaged files view used to only be like this in Git repositories. I think for Mercurial repositories there was only one section in this view. When an unstaged file is checked, it isn't moved into the Staged files, so it seems like that might be related to the issue.
fields.summary: Checkbox next to "Unstaged files" no longer works in Mercurial

fields.description: I work in sourcetree all the time, watching any change made by the team, the new version changes to "File status" tab every 10 minutes, so I need to switch to "Log/History" tab every time.
fields.summary: Automatically changes to the File Status tab when I'm watching the Log/History tab

With any branch right clicking > Create pull request... throws a null reference exception. Any branch state will cause this. Local, pushed, pending changes, etc.

fields.summary: Crash when trying to create Pull Request

fields.description: You've put Gitflow into a menu. You should put it back into the toolbar. My team uses it all the time.
fields.summary: Bring back the Gitflow button in the toolbar

fields.description:
Mercurial can not be activated.
SourceTree Do not find hg.exe manualy and auto
fields.summary: Mercurial plugin does not turn on

fields.description:
When focused the UI of SourceTree continuously refreshes (once every 500ms or so) making using the software impossible. See attached for demo.
This is particularly annoying when trying to view the "Log / History" tab, since each refresh keeps setting it back to the "File status" tab.

Potentially related, the "push changes immediately to..." checkbox under the commit text box is continuously being enabled then disabled.

Issue still exists with both 
  Repository settings > Advanced > automatically refresh...
and
  Tools > Options > General > refresh automatically... 
unchecked.
Issue still exists with Visual Studio closed.
fields.summary: GUI continuously refreshes making use impossible

fields.description: Updating the client from some 1.7 version (four updates were available) to 1.8.1. After the installation process, a (new?) screen like a wizard was shown. On the third (?) step (when asked to configure github, bitbucket, etc...) I skipped. The wizard closed and the chash and bug report window was presented.
fields.summary: Crash during setup wizard after install (update)

fields.description: Prior to upgrading to 1.8.1 you could double click a file in Log / History and if associations were set it would open in your text editor. Double clicking the file causes SourceTree to crash. Right clicking to open the file still works.
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes when double clicking file in Log / History tab

fields.description: Clicked a file in the unstaged list. Then Shift-Clicked a file down from the first to select multiple files. When I went to drag them to the Staged window it just selected a single file, the file I clicked on when trying to drag the group of files.
fields.summary: Can't drag and drop multiple files from unstaged to staged window.
Crashing !!!

fields.description:
In builds prior to 1.8, the stage changes button was visible without having to scroll to the right. With 1.8, they're now right aligned to the entire window making them hidden off the screen.

Combine this with the fact that you can no longer expand the diff view (it lets you grab it like it thinks you should be able to but won't actually resize) and you've got a really hard to use feature.
fields.summary: Position of stage changes button

fields.description: Text of the commit using the wrong codepage or glyphs. First character of every line looks weird. See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Changes View displays text incorrectly.

fields.description: RIght click remote branch - "Pull xxx into current branch" the pull screen "Remote branch to pull" defaults to current branch rather than xxx
fields.summary: Pull from branch not defaulting to correct branch

fields.description: when resolving conflicts every time I close beyond compare source tree crashes.
fields.summary: Crash when closing BeyondCompare to finish conflict resolution.
GitFlow broken !

fields.description: As soon as I select the affected repository in the bookmarks, it goes into the Log/History view and freezes. The CPU has one of its cores at 100% usage and waiting for a long time (~15 minutes) didn't solve the problem. This only happens on one of my newer repositories. There is only one commit to show (Initial Commit) and it contains ~50 files. No errors are generated. I've reverted to version 1.6.0  and it works fine (I couldn't find version 1.7.0 on your server, but it previously worked there too) and loads instantly.
fields.summary: Log/History makes SourceTree 1.8.1 freeze

fields.description:
I just updated to 1.8.1 and now I basically cannot do anything with any of my mercurial repos. All of their states are detached from the branches and when I try to update to any state along a branch, it completes, but actually does nothing. Then, when I try to update --clean, it gives me an error:

hg update -y -r 142 --clean
abort: The system cannot find the file specified

Then, when I try to stage a changed file, I get the same error:

hg add -y content/mu-plugins/rainmaker
abort: The system cannot find the file specified

When I try to pull in remote changes to a repo:

hg pull -u C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Local\Temp\fnc5tnov.kzu
pulling from C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Local\Temp\fnc5tnov.kzu
searching for changes
adding changesets
adding manifests
adding file changes
added 1 changesets with 1 changes to 1 files

abort: The system cannot find the file specified


I'm dead in the water here. I can't do any work until this is resolved!
fields.summary: File not found error preventing ALL ACTIONS

fields.description:
After update to 1.8.1, sub-modules are well checked-out but there is no valid bookmark for them, when one clicks on the bookmark it pops up a dialog box saying REPOSITORY MISSING.

Same behavior with pre-existing cloned repository.
fields.summary: sub-modules folder  not valid anymore

fields.description:
New UX is very gray on pale gray which is hard enough, but when it is white on pale gray such as when committing (git for me !image-2016-02-16-11-57-56-774.png|thumbnail! ) it is completely unreadable !!!

See attached.
fields.summary: Win10: When committing via git some text is white on gray and thus unreadable

fields.description:
1. Change the tracked files in git working copy.
2. Try to drag modified file from unstaged files area and drop it into staged files area.
Observe that you can't do this.
fields.summary: Files Drag and drop broken

fields.description: The icons in the app do not look as crisp as expected. They feel blurry, and not pleasing to the eye. Attached is a comparison of the icons as they look in my computer, against the icons in Microsoft Edge containing this very text I'm writing right now.
fields.summary: Icons do not look crisp in latest version

fields.description:
I like the new version which is nicer than the 1.7 that was out there, but my problem is that the tree view is gone! It's all a flat list. Even if I try to click on removing the checkmark, it's disabled. 

Can you bring that back please?
fields.summary: What happened to the Tree View List in Staged/Unstaged files?
Crash on startup

fields.description: In previous versions, this operation used to open the file.
fields.summary: Double click file from diff with another branch results crashes sourcetree.

Just downloaded the last update of SourceTree and now I got the 1.8.1 version. When I try to initialize Git Flow throught SourceTree I get the following error:

sh.exe C:\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\gitflow_local\gitflow\git-flow init -d

SourceTree prompted to upgrade so I let it.  After the upgrade it crashes immediately when trying to launch it.  During the setup I clicked the "skip" button when it got to the online hosting accounts.

Log is attached.

fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when opeing repository

fields.description: The gitflow button is missing - how can that happen...?
fields.summary: Gitflow is missing

fields.description:
You'll need a project with submodules and a bookmark on a submodule of the project.
1. Open the Bookmarks pane by clicking on View/Show/Hide Bookmarks.
2. Double click on a bookmark for a submodule.

Result: An error dialog pops up: Repository Missing (see attachment).
Expected: A tab for the submodule should open.

Troubleshooting:
I deleted the bookmark. Then double clicked on the submodule under the projectin the navigation pane. This prompted me to create a bookmark, which I did. And the tab for the submodule was opened. I closed the tab, and double clicked on the newly created bookmark, and I got the same error dialog.

I have my bookmarks organized into folders. The folder represents the project and the bookmarks under the folder are for the main project and all of its submodules. I don't know if this has anything to do with reproducing the bug or not.
fields.summary: Bookmarks on submodules won't open

fields.description: I try to install the GIT standalone and it crashes.
fields.summary: GIT Standalone Crashes

fields.description: I normally keep my view at log/history, but now when I task back into SourceTree, if it detects there are changed files it automatically switches to the File Status view.  This is very annoying.
fields.summary: View auto changes from log/history to File status

fields.description:
What's wrong with you people? Bring back the colorful icons!
Haven't you got your lesson from failure of Microsoft about gray flat icons on Win8 and VS12?
They even brought back the colorful icons. Please DON'T RUIN SourceTree with that FLAT GRAY #@!^@#!!
fields.summary: Bring back the colorful icons! (This is an ultimatum)

fields.description: When viewing file diffs in the log the "reverse hunk/file" button ends up to the right of the longest line of text and therefore it is often scrolled offscreen.  Observer in the Capture1.png the button is half offscreen and the scrollbar is scrolled to the left, and in Capture2, the scrollbar is scrolled right and the button is fully visible
fields.summary: Reverse hunk/file button in file diff ends up offscreen

fields.description: Sourcetree is shut down, when i tried to push commit, that have subproject changes
fields.summary: Shut down

fields.description:
When choosing certain commits, sourcetree hangs for a long time (not sure how long, killed it after minutes). In the task manager I can see that sourcetree is using 50% cpu usage constantly, from the moment of hanging.
In de last 20 commits, I find 2 that I cannot view, because of hanging behaviour. It is reproducable, trying to view the same commits results in this behaviour.

It does not always generate logging, but I think in the attached logfile it has.

Additional findings:
resizing the sourcetree window makes viewing some commits not to crash sourcetree (maybe helpful to know?)
fields.summary: Sourcetree hangs when viewing specific commit

fields.description:
I updated from 1.7.something via 1.8.0.36401 today, and noticed:
* The current branch is no longer displayed in the bottom right
* When switching branch the first screen is now File Status (empty), instead of Log/History
* SourceTree is freezing and becoming unresponsive every few minutes
fields.summary: Current Branch no longer showing bottom-right

fields.description:
SourceTree was crashing once my repository's tab UI loaded. I restarted it several times and it continued to happen.

I launched it without it crashing by quickly navigating to a different view. Having done this, I determined that it would crash when viewing the diff for a {{.css.map}} file. The application does not crash when I navigate to views which contain other diffs. Upon performing a {{checkout}} on the {{.css.map}} file through a terminal, SourceTree is capable of viewing the other uncommitted changes. Oddly, it doesn't crash when rendering some of my other {{.css.map}} files, but it fails to display the diff nonetheless. I created a {{foo.css.map}} file, to which I wrote a single character. SourceTree refuses to display a diff for this file.

Here is the top of one of the stack traces in the crash log:

{code}
ERROR [2016-02-16 15:03:10,356] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.ArgumentException: The number of elements in this collection must be less than or equal to '65535'.

fields.summary: Crash when rendering diff

fields.description: In the new version the Git Flow button is missing in the top "icon-bar". I also couldn't find any setting to add it back it.
fields.summary: Git Flow missing in GUI Icon-Bar

fields.description: When files are staged/unstaged individually the progress bar and dark backround appear for a fraction of a second spoiling the UI experience. This does not happen when selecting all files.
fields.summary: Staging/unstaging a single file displays shortly the progress bar affecting the UI experience

fields.description: Entering a string (eg a filename) into the search box on SourceTree does not filter the displayed files to those matching the string. This makes locating files in projects cumbersome.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 1.8.1 Search box does not search for files matching string given
